Co-infection or superinfection with the hepatitis D virus (HDV) alters the course of type B hepatitis. It encourages chronicity and enhances severity, 47., 48., 49. except after liver transplantation. The antigen, HDAg, can easily be demonstrated immunohistochemically in paraffin sections and is mainly found in hepatocyte nuclei ( Fig. 6.17 ). These may have finely granular eosinophilic centres (so-called sanded nuclei
50 ). Cytoplasmic and membrane-associated staining is also sometimes seen.
